soba_userInput: create an alternative mind map for baroque music, better organised, and completing the missing information of the model
soba_metaModelContext:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ecore:EPackage xmi:version="2.0" xmlns:xmi="http://www.omg.org/XMI" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:ecore="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore" name="mindMap" nsURI="http://mindmap/0.1" nsPrefix="map">
  <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EClass" name="Map">
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="name">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="description">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="root" eType="//Concept" containment="true"/>
  </eClassifiers>
  <eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EClass" name="Concept">
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="name">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="subConcepts" upperBound="-1" eType="//Concept" containment="true" eOpposite="//Concept/parent"/>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="parent" eType="//Concept" eOpposite="//Concept/subConcepts"/>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EAttribute" name="description">
      <eType xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" href="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore#//EString"/>
    </eStructuralFeatures>
    <eStructuralFeatures xsi:type="ecore:EReference" name="relatedTo" upperBound="-1" eType="//Concept"/>
  </eClassifiers>
</ecore:EPackage>

subConcepts.name: J.S. Bach
subConcepts.description: Johann Sebastian Bach (1685–1750). Central figure of late Baroque; known for fugues, cantatas, Brandenburg Concertos, The Well-Tempered Clavier, Mass in B minor.

subConcepts.name: G.F. Handel
subConcepts.description: George Frideric Handel (1685–1759). Composer of operas, oratorios (e.g., Messiah) and instrumental music; active in England.

subConcepts.name: A. Vivaldi
subConcepts.description: Antonio Vivaldi (1678–1741). Italian composer noted for violin concertos (The Four Seasons) and contributions to solo concerto form.

subConcepts.name: Composers
subConcepts.description: Key composers of the Late Baroque period and their roles.

subConcepts.name: Fugue & Counterpoint
subConcepts.description: Highly developed contrapuntal techniques; fugues as a central compositional form.

subConcepts.name: Basso continuo
subConcepts.description: Continuo (figured bass) providing harmonic foundation, typically harpsichord/organ with cello or bassoon.

subConcepts.name: Terraced dynamics
subConcepts.description: Abrupt shifts in volume rather than gradual crescendos; common in Baroque performance practice.

subConcepts.name: Characteristics
subConcepts.description: Musical and performance traits distinctive of the Late Baroque.

subConcepts.name: Concerto grosso
subConcepts.description: Contrast between a small group of soloists (concertino) and full ensemble (ripieno).

subConcepts.name: Solo concerto
subConcepts.description: Virtuosic solo instrument contrasted with orchestra; developed notably by Vivaldi.

subConcepts.name: Oratorio
subConcepts.description: Large-scale vocal genre similar to opera but performed without staging; Handel is a key figure.

subConcepts.name: Forms & Genres
subConcepts.description: Principal musical forms and genres in the Late Baroque.

subConcepts.name: Brandenburg Concertos
subConcepts.description: Set of six concertos by J.S. Bach showcasing concerto grosso and soloist writing.

subConcepts.name: The Four Seasons
subConcepts.description: Four violin concertos by Vivaldi, each accompanied by a sonnet and programmatic elements.

subConcepts.name: Messiah
subConcepts.description: Oratorio by Handel, emblematic of late Baroque vocal-orchestral writing.

subConcepts.name: Notable works
subConcepts.description: Representative works of the Late Baroque period.
